meanings.definition: Tending to exclude or characterized by exclusion
meanings.sent1: The exclusionary policy kept many students out of the club.
meanings.sent2: Her exclusionary behavior made it difficult for others to join the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The exclusionary rule of no pets allowed meant even the class hamster couldn't come in.
meanings.sent4: The exclusionary nature of the VIP section made everyone outside feel like outsiders.
meanings.sent5: The exclusionary fence around the garden kept the rabbits from eating the vegetables.

meanings.definition: Serving to exclude or bar certain individuals or groups
meanings.sent1: The exclusionary test only allowed students with a passcode to enter.
meanings.sent2: The exclusionary criteria for the scholarship left many applicants disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The exclusionary dress code for the party required guests to wear a specific color.
meanings.sent4: The exclusionary barrier at the entrance prevented unauthorized personnel from entering.
meanings.sent5: The exclusionary sign on the door warned trespassers to stay out.

meanings.definition: Showing a preference for excluding others
meanings.sent1: His exclusionary attitude towards new team members created tension in the group.
meanings.sent2: The exclusionary clique only allowed certain students to sit at their lunch table.
meanings.sent3: The exclusionary cat refused to let any other pets near its favorite spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The exclusionary boss always picked the same employees for special projects.
meanings.sent5: The exclusionary club had strict rules that made it hard for new members to join.
